methods.name: owner
methods.desc: @devReturns the address of the current owner.

methods.name: _checkOwner
methods.desc: @devThrows if the sender is not the owner.

methods.name: transferOwnership
methods.desc: @devTransfers ownership of the application to a new account (`newOwner`).Can only be called by the current owner.

methods.name: pendingOwner
methods.desc: @devReturns the address of the pending owner.

methods.name: transferOwnership2S
methods.desc: @devStarts the ownership transfer of the contract to a new account. Replaces the pending transfer if there is one.Can only be called by the current owner.FIX: Once overrides exist, rename to transferOwnership

methods.name: acceptOwnership
methods.desc: @devThe new owner accepts the ownership transfer.

methods.name: depositForBurn
methods.desc: @noticeDeposits and burns tokens from sender to be minted on destination domain.Emits a`DepositForBurn`event.@devreverts if:- given burnToken is not supported- given destinationDomain has no TokenMessenger registered- transferFrom() reverts. For example, if sender's burnToken balance or approved allowanceto this contract is less than`amount`.- burn() reverts. For example, if`amount`is 0.- MessageTransmitter returns false or reverts.

args.name: axfer
args.desc: asset transfer of tokens to burn

args.name: destinationDomain
args.desc: destination domain

args.name: mintRecipient
args.desc: address of mint recipient on destination domain

args.name: burnToken
args.desc: address of contract to burn deposited tokens, on local domain@return_nonce unique nonce reserved by message

methods.name: depositForBurnWithCaller
methods.desc: @noticeDeposits and burns tokens from sender to be minted on destination domain. The minton the destination domain must be called by`destinationCaller`.WARNING: if the`destinationCaller`does not represent a valid address as bytes32, then it will not be possibleto broadcast the message on the destination domain. This is an advanced feature, and the standarddepositForBurn() should be preferred for use cases where a specific destination caller is not required.Emits a`DepositForBurn`event.@devreverts if:- given destinationCaller is zero address- given burnToken is not supported- given destinationDomain has no TokenMessenger registered- transferFrom() reverts. For example, if sender's burnToken balance or approved allowanceto this contract is less than`amount`.- burn() reverts. For example, if`amount`is 0.- MessageTransmitter returns false or reverts.

args.name: axfer
args.desc: amount of tokens to burn (must be non-zero)

args.name: destinationDomain
args.desc: destination domain

args.name: mintRecipient
args.desc: address of mint recipient on destination domain

args.name: burnToken
args.desc: address of contract to burn deposited tokens, on local domain

args.name: destinationCaller
args.desc: caller on the destination domain, as bytes32@returnnonce unique nonce reserved by message

methods.name: replaceDepositForBurn
methods.desc: @noticeReplace a BurnMessage to change the mint recipient and/ordestination caller. Allows the sender of a previous BurnMessage(created by depositForBurn or depositForBurnWithCaller)to send a new BurnMessage to replace the original.The new BurnMessage will reuse the amount and burn token of the original,without requiring a new deposit.@devThe new message will reuse the original message's nonce. For agiven nonce, all replacement message(s) and the original message arevalid to broadcast on the destination domain, until the first messageat the nonce confirms, at which point all others are invalidated.Note: The msg.sender of the replaced message must be the same as themsg.sender of the original message.

args.name: originalMessage
args.desc: original message bytes (to replace)

args.name: originalAttestation
args.desc: original attestation bytes

args.name: newDestinationCaller
args.desc: the new destination caller, which may be thesame as the original destination caller, a new destination caller, or an emptydestination caller (bytes32(0), indicating that any destination caller is valid.)

args.name: newMintRecipient
args.desc: the new mint recipient, which may be the same as theoriginal mint recipient, or different.

methods.name: handleReceiveMessage
methods.desc: @noticeHandles an incoming message received by the local MessageTransmitter,and takes the appropriate action. For a burn message, mints theassociated token to the requested recipient on the local domain.@devValidates the local sender is the local MessageTransmitter, and theremote sender is a registered remote TokenMessenger for`remoteDomain`.

args.name: remoteDomain
args.desc: The domain where the message originated from.

args.name: sender
args.desc: The sender of the message (remote TokenMessenger).

args.name: messageBody
args.desc: The message body bytes.@returnsuccess Bool, true if successful.

methods.name: addRemoteTokenMessenger
methods.desc: @noticeAdd the TokenMessenger for a remote domain.@devReverts if there is already a TokenMessenger set for domain.

args.name: domain
args.desc: Domain of remote TokenMessenger.

args.name: tokenMessenger
args.desc: Address of remote TokenMessenger as bytes32.

methods.name: removeRemoteTokenMessenger
methods.desc: @noticeRemove the TokenMessenger for a remote domain.@devReverts if there is no TokenMessenger set for`domain`.

args.name: domain
args.desc: Domain of remote TokenMessenger

methods.name: addLocalMinter
methods.desc: @noticeAdd minter for the local domain.@devReverts if a minter is already set for the local domain.

args.name: newLocalMinter
args.desc: The address of the minter on the local domain.

methods.name: removeLocalMinter
methods.desc: @noticeRemove the minter for the local domain.@devReverts if the minter of the local domain is not set.

args.name: _messageTransmitter
args.desc: Message transmitter address

args.name: _messageBodyVersion
args.desc: Message body version
